newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo aluminium futures end higher in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo aluminium futures end higher in thin trade.

text.p: Tokyo aluminium futures closed higher on Tuesday as a firming of the dollar triggered short-covering and bargain-hunting in thin trade, traders said.
Traders expected prices to remain in a narrow range in the near-term future with the London market in the doldrums.

TOCOM prices were 0.2 to 1.3 yen higher, with the benchmark February contract showing the largest gain of 1.3 yen to 204.8 yen per kg. The day's volume was a thin 3,124 lots, little changed from Monday's 2,930 lots.
"We've seen short-covering and bargain-hunting after the February contract's lows yesterday," said one trader. February hit an intraday low of 203.4 on Monday.
"The market is directionless, particularly as nobody is interested in the metal's longer-term trend," the trader said.
